item.title: US, UAE Discuss Progress On India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor
item.description: Joe Biden and his counterpart from the UAE Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed discussed the progress of the landmark India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor (IMEC) and underscored its potential to usher in a "new era of international connectivity".

item.title: Zelensky Says Ukraine "Closer To End Of War" With Russia
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said that his country is "closer to the end of the war" with Russia, according to excerpts of an interview with ABC News released on Monday.

item.title: US To Discuss "Concrete Ideas" With Allies To Prevent Israel-Hezbollah War
item.description: The U.S. does not support the escalation between Israel and Hezbollah across the border, a senior State Department official said, adding that Washington was going to discuss "concrete ideas" with allies and partners to prevent the war from broadening

item.title: López Obrador changed Mexico — but not in the ways he promised
item.description: The president’s support for the working poor was wildly popular. But he left much of his predecessors’ policies in place, and corruption, violence and impunity remain rampant.

item.title: Australia news live: ‘we are deeply concerned by escalation’ in Lebanon, Wong says; Tony Armstrong announces departure from ABC breakfast show
item.description:
Follow today’s news live

  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

Tony Armstrong is leaving ABC News Breakfast for a new show screening in 2025. He told viewers this morning:

I just want to thank Brekky and the broader ABC News team for welcoming me in with open arms and helping me grow over the past few years. I love live TV and those moments that are unplanned and unpredictable where anything can happen. I’ve been so lucky to be surrounded by an incredible team and it’s those friendships that I’m going to cherish the most.

How blessed we’ve been to have Tone on our screens every morning, bringing the sparkle, joy and heart that only Tony can! Tony is a wonderful friend and everyone at News Breakfast is going to miss his infectious and caring nature. I know it’s meant so much to me and to thousands upon thousands of First Nations viewers waking up to see Tony representing us on the daily. Can’t wait to see what you do next, Tone! Maybe sleep?!

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump to speak at campaign rally in swing-state Pennsylvania – live
item.description:
Republican nominee returns to battleground state after JD Vance dodges Mark Robinson question in North Carolina

Kamala Harris has seen a surge in favorability among voters and is increasingly viewed as the candidate most likely to bring change, a NBC News poll released on Sunday found.

Among registered voters nationwide, the vice-president is ahead by five percentage points, with 49% support against Donald Trump’s 44%. She is also seen as the candidate more likely to bring “change”, a potentially significant finding given that other surveys have found many Americans believe the country is on the wrong track. Among respondents, 47% say Harris represents change, while 38% say the same of Trump.

Continue reading...
